gurmukhi: gopn kI ibnqI sunIAY piq iDAwn DrY ieh ko rx gwmI ]iDAwn DrY ieh ko mun eISr iDAwn DrY ieh kwier kwmI ]
transliteration: Gopan Kibintisouneeai Pat(i) Dhiaan Ddarai Eh Ko Ran Gadmee|| Dhiaan Ddarai Eh Ko Mounndeeshar Dhiaan Ddarai Eh Kaair Kaamee||
translation: “O Nand! We are saying this that the warriors meditate on this Krishna; even the sages, Shive, ordinary individuals, lustful persons etc. also meditate on him;

gurmukhi: iDAwn DrY iehko su qiRXw sB iDAwn DrY ieh dyKn bwmI ]s`iq lKXo hmkY krqw jg s`iq khXo mq kY nih KwmI ]393]
transliteration: Dhiaan Ddarai Ihko Su Triyaa Sabh Dhiaan Ddarai Eh Dekhan Baamee|| Satt(i) Lakhyo Hamkai Kartaa Jag Satt(i) Kahyo Mat Kai Nah(i) Khaamee||393||
translation: “All the women meditate on him; the world acknowledges him as the Creator, which is quite true, there is no flaw in it.”393.

gurmukhi: hY Bgvwn blI pRgtXo sB gop khY puqnw ien mwrI ]rwj BBICn Xwih dXo ienhI kup rwvn dYq sMGwrI ]
transliteration: Hai Bhagvaan Balipragadyo Sabh Gop Kahai Poutanaa In Mdaree|| Raaj Bhabheechhan Yaah(i) Dayo Inhikoup Raavan Dait Sanhdaree||
translation: “This mighty Lord has destroyed Putana; he killed Ravana and gave the kingdom to Vibhishana;

gurmukhi: r`C krI pHlwdih kI ien hI hrnwKS kI aur PwrI ]nMd suno pq lokn kY ienhI hmrI Ab dyh aubwrI ]394]
transliteration: Rachchh Kariprahlaadah(i) Kiin Hiharnaakhash Kiur Phdaree|| Nand Souno Pat Lokan Kai Inhihamriab Deh Oubharee||394||
translation: He protected Prahalada by bursting open the belly of Hiranayakashipu; O Nand, the lord of the people ! listen, He had now saved us.”394.

gurmukhi: hY sB logn ko krqw biRj BIq rhY krqw ieh lIlw ]is`KXn ko brqw hir hY ieh swDn ko hirqw qn hIlw ]
transliteration: Hai Sabh Logad Ko Kartaa Brij Bheet Rahai Kartaa Eh Leelaa|| Sikkhyan Ko Bartaa Brij Rahai Kartaa Eh Leelaa|| Sikkhyan Ko Bartaa Har(i) Hai Eh Saadhan Ko Haritaa Tan Heelaa||
translation: “He is the Creater of all the people; on this side, the whole of Braja was fearful and he was engaged in his amorous play; Krishna is the fast of the disciples and he is also the effort in the saint’s body;

gurmukhi: rwK leI ienhI sIA kI piq rwiK leI qiRX pwrQ sIlw ]gop khY pq so sunIAY ieh hY kiRSnM brbIr hTIlw ]395]
transliteration: Raakh Laiinhiseea Kipat(i) Raakh(i) Laitriya Paarath Seelaa|| Gop Kahai Pat So Souneeai Eh Hai Krishnan Barbeer Hatheelaa||395||
translation: “He protected the high character of Sita and Daropati; “O Nand ! the performer of all these works is this persistent Krishna.”395.

gurmukhi: idn bIq gey ck ey igr ky hir jI bCry sMg lY bn jwvY ]ijau Dr mUriq Gwsu cugY Bgvwn mhwN mn mY suK pwvY ]
transliteration: Din Beet Gad Chak E Gir Ke Har(i) Jibachhre San Lai Ban Jaavai|| Jio Dhar Maarat(i) Ghaas(u) Chougad Bhagvaan Mahaan Man Mai Soukh Paavai||
translation: “Many days elapsed after the event of carrying the mountain; now Krishna began to go to the forest alongwith the calves; seeing the cows grazing there, the Lord (Krishna) remined absorbed in bliss in his mind;

gurmukhi: lY murlI Apny kr mY kr Bwv Gny ihq swQ bjwvY ]moih rhY ju sunY pqnI sur moih rhY Duin jo sun pwvY ]396]
transliteration: Lai Mrliapne Kar Mai Kar Bhaav Ghane Hit Saath Bajaavai|| Moh(i) Rahai Ju Sounai Patnisur Moh(i) Rahai Dhoun(i) Jo Soun Paavai||396||
translation: “Taking up his flute in his hand, he played on it having filled with intensive emotion, everyone who listened to the sound of the flute, including the heavenly damsels, got allured.396.

gurmukhi: kup ky ijn bwil mrXo iCn mY Aru rwvn kI ijn sYn mrIhY ]jwih BBICn rwj dXo iCn mY ijh kI iqh lMk krIhY ]
transliteration: Koup Ke Jin Baal(i) Daryo Chhin Mai Ar(u) Raavan Kijin Sain Daree-hai|| Jaah(i) Bhabheechhan Raaj Dayo Chhin Mai Jih Kitih Lank Daree-hai||
translation: “He, who killed Bali in rage and destroyed the army of Ravana; he, who gave the kingdom (of Landa) to Vibhishana and made him the Lord of Lanka in an instant;

gurmukhi: mur mwir dXo Gtkw n krI irp jw sIA kI jIX pIr hrI hY ]so biRj BUim ibKY Bgvwn su gaUAn ky ims Kyl krI hY ]397]
transliteration: Mur Daar(i) Dayo Ghatkaa Na Karirip Jaa Seea Kijeeya Peer Harihai|| So Brij Bhoom(i) Bikhai Bhagvaan Su Gadoan Ke Mis Khel Karihai||397||
translation: “He, who killed the demon named Sura and killing the enemy, removed the suffering of Sita, the same Lord, having taken birth in Braja, is playing with his cows.397.
